intro: Minuartia laricifolia, commonly known as the mountain rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically thrives in rocky or alpine environments. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are usually small, linear, and covered in a fine layer of white hair, aiding in water retention. Minuartia laricifolia is often found in mountainous regions across Europe, Asia, and North America.
